Award.AwardTitle: Women in the Sciences Leadership Workshop; Boulder, Colorado; November 4-8, 2019
Award.AbstractNarration:
The Women in Sciences Leadership Workshop 2019 is an opportunity for scientists (e.g., graduate students to senior federal scientists) to interact with one another, build new networks, and develop important skill sets. This proposal will provide support to allow scientists to participate in this workshop. Building on the success of a similar workshop in 2018, this year will double the number of participants from 50 to 100. The requested funding will assist with covering the costs of hotel funds for all participants and for full travel funding for up to 10 participants with significant financial need. Two workshops will take place in Boulder, CO, November 4-6 and November 5-8, 2019.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The two workshops funded by this project allowed for 100 women to participate in a 2.5 day leadership training specifically for women in a scientific field. The goal of the workshop was to increase women scientists’ ability to succeed in their careers in scientific organizations. The participants ranged from graduate students to tenured professors and senior leadership, and everything in between. The women learned about their strengths from a DiSC profile assessment and how to best utilize those strengths in their careers. They also learned valuable skills such as negotiation, mentoring, giving feedback and work-life integration. The survey taken at the end of the workshop showed participants rated the quality and activities provided as highly satisfactory. They also were highly satisfied with the leadership skills they learned being applicable to their career path. 

 

We proposed two, two and a half day professional development workshops for women in the sciences to be held in the fall of 2019 in Boulder, CO. The goals of this project were to provide women the opportunity to travel to attend the Women in the Sciences Leadership Workshop held in Boulder, CO. This workshop was offered in the past and had several women decline to participate due to the cost of travel. This allowed for 18 women to be fully funded for their travel and 60 women to have the cost of their local accommodations covered.

Over 100 women from academia, government, non-profits, and the private sector participated in the workshops. Over 200 applications for this workshop were received, showing a strong interest and need in the community. Women ranged in rank from graduate students to tenured professors and senior leadership, and everything in between, leading to a rich diversity of experience and needs related to leadership and management.
